ARABIC: أَمْ أَنَا۠ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ مَهِينٌ وَلَا يَكَادُ يُبِينُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Am I not better than this man who is contemptible and can scarcely make anything clear?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Am I (not) better than him who is contemptible, and cannot even express himself clearly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Am I better or this contemptible man who is scarcely able to express himself?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Am I not better than this lowly man who can barely express himself?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Or that I am better than him, for he is lowly – and he does not seem to talk plainly.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Am I not better than this one (Musa) who is despicable and can scarcely express himself clearly"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! I am better than this fellow, who is contemptible, and who can hardly speak distinctly:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Or am I better than this man, who is contemptible and scarcely makes things clear?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable and can hardly make (his meaning) plain!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Am I not better than this contemptible man who can hardly make his meaning clear:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Aye! I am better than this one who is depicable, and well- nigh cannot make himself plain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Am I not better than this wretch who cannot even speak clearly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Am I not better than this (Moses), who is a contemptible wretch and can scarcely express himself clearly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Am I not better than this one [Musa (Moses)], who is Mahin [has no honour nor any respect, and is weak and despicable] and can scarcely express himself clearly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Am I not better than this contemptible (man), who can scarcely make things clear (because of the impediment of his speech)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Am I not better than this miserable wretch, who can barely express himself?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or am I [not] better than this one who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:52] Or, do you perceive, in which case, am I not better than this one, namely, Moses, who is contemptible, feeble and lowly, and who can scarcely speak clearly?, [who can scarcely] articulate his speech, because of his lisp — which was the result of his [accidentally] placing a hot coal in his mouth when he was a child.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable) physically weak, (and can hardly make (his meaning) plain) his argument plain!
